formalpara.title: Internal help for this function in Asterisk 1.4:

para.screen:
-= Info about function 'STRPTIME' =-
[Syntax] STRPTIME(<datetime>|<timezone>|<format>)
[Synopsis] Returns the epoch of the arbitrary date/time string structured as described in the format.
[Description] This is useful for converting a date into an EPOCH time, possibly to pass to an application like SayUnixTime or to calculate the difference between two date strings.
Example: ${STRPTIME(2006-03-01 07:30:35|America/Chicago|%%%%Y-%%%%m-%%%%d %%%%H:%%%%M:%%%%S)} returns 1141219835
